data.enText: set sb/sth free
to let sb/sth come out of a place where they have been kept or trapped
to release a prisoner/hostage

data.chText: 消防队员花了两个小时将司机从汽车残骸中救出来。
data.enText: Firefighters took two hours to release the driver from the wreckage.
stop holding sth

data.chText: 放开；松开；使自由移动（或飞翔、降落等）
data.enText: to stop holding sth or stop it from being held so that it can move, fly, fall, etc. freely
He refused to release her arm.

data.chText: 典礼上放飞了一万个气球。
data.enText: 10 000 balloons were released at the ceremony.
Intense heat is released in the reaction.
feelings
to express feelings such as anger or worry in order to get rid of them

data.chText: 她放声大哭，发泄出全部郁积起来的情感。
data.enText: She burst into tears, releasing all her pent-up emotions.
free sb from duty

data.chText: 免除，解除（某人的职责、责任、合同等）；解雇
data.enText: to free sb from a duty, responsibility, contract, etc.

data.chText: 俱乐部正在解聘一些老队员。
data.enText: The club is releasing some of its older players.

data.chText: 新的法律免除了雇主承认工会的义务。
data.enText: The new law released employers from their obligation to recognize unions.
part of machine
to remove sth from a fixed position, allowing sth else to move or function

data.chText: 松开离合器、手闸、开关等
data.enText: to release the clutch/handbrake/switch, etc.
make less tight
to make sth less tight
You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
make available
to make sth available to the public

data.chText: 关于这次事故，警方没有透露更多的细节。
data.enText: Police have released no further details about the accident.

data.chText: 发行电影 / 书 / 激光唱片
data.enText: to release a movie/book/CD
new products released onto the market
to make sth available that had previously been restricted

data.chText: 政府一拨付资金，新的建筑项目就动工。
data.enText: The new building programme will go ahead as soon as the government releases the funds.
setting sb/sth free
the act of setting a person or an animal free; the state of being set free

data.chText: 政府一直在努力争取使人质获释。
data.enText: The government has been working to secure the release of the hostages.
She can expect an early release from prison.
making sth available
the act of making sth available to the public

data.chText: 新软件计划四月份发行。
data.enText: The new software is planned for release in April.

data.chText: 这部电影将于下周公开上映。
data.enText: The movie goes on general release (= will be widely shown in cinemas/movie theaters) next week.

data.chText: 新发行的东西；（尤指）新激光唱片，新电影
data.enText: a thing that is made available to the public, especially a new CD or film/movie
the latest new releases
of gas/chemical
the act of letting a gas, chemical, etc. come out of the container where it has been safely held

data.chText: 二氧化碳向大气层的排放
data.enText: the release of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere
to monitor radiation releases
from unpleasant feeling
the feeling that you are free from pain, anxiety or some other unpleasant feeling
a sense of release after the exam

data.chText: 我认为她的死是一种幸运的解脱。
data.enText: I think her death was a merciful release.

simple_means.memory_skill: re 重新 + leas 松 + e → 释放

means: 使自由移动(或飞翔、降落等)

tr: the act of liberating someone or something
(music) the act or manner of terminating a musical phrase or tone
a formal written statement of relinquishment
the termination of someone's employment (leaving them free to depart)
the act of allowing a fluid to escape
activity that frees or expresses creative energy or emotion
example: she had no other outlet for her feelings
he gave vent to his anger

tr: merchandise issued for sale or public showing (especially a record or film)
example: a new release from the London Symphony Orchestra

tr: a device that when pressed will release part of a mechanism
a legal document evidencing the discharge of a debt or obligation
an announcement distributed to members of the press in order to supplement or replace an oral presentation
euphemistic expressions for death
a process that liberates or discharges something
example: there was a sudden release of oxygen
the release of iodine from the thyroid gland

tr: generate and separate from cells or bodily fluids
example: release a hormone into the blood stream

tr: eliminate (a substance)
example: combustion products are exhausted in the engine

tr: make (assets) available
example: release the holdings in the dictator's bank account

tr: prepare and issue for public distribution or sale
let (something) fall or spill from a container
example: turn the flour onto a plate

tr: release, as from one's grip
example: Let go of the door handle, please!
relinquish your grip on the rope--you won't fall

tr: release (gas or energy) as a result of a chemical reaction or physical decomposition
part with a possession or right
example: I am relinquishing my bedroom to the long-term house guest
resign a claim to the throne

tr: grant freedom to
free from confinement
make (information) available for publication
example: release the list with the names of the prisoners

value.def: If a person or animal is released from somewhere where they have been locked up or looked after, they are set free or allowed to go.

example.ex: He was released from custody the next day...
example.tran: 第二天他被从拘留所里放了出来。

example.ex: He is expected to be released from hospital today...
example.tran: 他有望今天出院。

example.ex: Fifty-five foxes were released from a fur farm by animal rights activists...
example.tran: 动物权利保护主义者把55只狐狸从毛皮动物饲养场放了出来。

example.ex: He was released on bail.
example.tran: 他被保释出来了。

value.def: When someone is released, you refer to their release .

example.ex: He called for the immediate release of all political prisoners.
example.tran: 他要求立即释放所有政治犯。

example.ex: ...the secret negotiations necessary to secure hostage releases...
example.tran: 为确保人质释放而要进行的秘密谈判

example.ex: Serious complications have delayed his release from hospital.
example.tran: 各种严重的并发症延迟了他的出院。

value.def: If someone or something releases you from a duty, task, or feeling, they free you from it.

example.ex: Divorce releases both the husband and wife from all marital obligations to each other...
example.tran: 离婚解除了夫妻双方相互之间所有的婚姻义务。

example.ex: This releases the teacher to work with individuals who are having extreme difficulty.
example.tran: 这使得教师可以专门辅导学习特别吃力的学生。

example.ex: ...release from stored tensions, traumas and grief...
example.tran: 使久积的紧张情绪、精神创伤和忧伤得以缓解

example.ex: They look on life at college as a blessed release from the obligation to work.
example.tran: 他们把大学生活看成是一种愉快的解脱，可以不用承担工作的义务。

value.def: To release feelings or abilities means to allow them to be expressed.

example.ex: Becoming your own person releases your creativity...
example.tran: 保持自己的本色才有助于发挥自身创造力。

example.ex: I personally don't want to release my anger on anyone else...
example.tran: 我个人并不想把自己的愤怒发泄在别人身上。

example.ex: Humour is wonderful for releasing tension.
example.tran: 幽默是舒缓紧张情绪的良方。

example.ex: She felt the sudden sweet release of her own tears.
example.tran: 她感到自己甜蜜的泪水一下子涌了出来。

value.tran: 发泄，释放(情感);展示(能力)

value.def: If someone in authority releases something such as a document or information, they make it available.

example.ex: They're not releasing any more details yet...
example.tran: 他们还未公布更多细节。

example.ex: Figures released yesterday show retail sales were down in March.
example.tran: 昨天公布的数据显示零售额在3月份有所下滑。

example.ex: Action had been taken to speed up the release of cheques.
example.tran: 已经采取行动加速支票的发放。

value.def: If you release someone or something, you stop holding them.

example.ex: He stopped and faced her, releasing her wrist.
example.tran: 他停下来面对着她，放开了她的手腕。

example.ex: ...the twisting action before a bowler releases the ball.
example.tran: 投球手掷球前的屈身动作

value.def: If you release a device, you move it so that it stops holding something.

example.ex: Wade released the hand brake and pulled away from the curb.
example.tran: 韦德松开手刹驶离路边。

value.tran: 打开，放开，松开(制动装置)

value.def: If something releases gas, heat, or a substance, it causes it to leave its container or the substance that it was part of and enter the surrounding atmosphere or area.

example.ex: ...a weapon which releases toxic nerve gas...
example.tran: 释放神经毒气的武器

example.ex: The contraction of muscles uses energy and releases heat...
example.tran: 肌肉的收缩消耗能量并且释放热量。

example.ex: The drug is surgically implanted into a woman's arm where it gradually releases the hormones into the body.
example.tran: 这种药物被通过手术的方式植入一位女子的手臂，它会逐渐向人体释放荷尔蒙。

example.ex: Under the agreement, releases of cancer-causing chemicals will be cut by about 80 per cent.
example.tran: 根据协议，致癌化学物的排放量将减少约80％。

value.tran: 释放，放出，排放(气体、热量或某种物质)

value.def: When an entertainer or company releases a new CD, video, or film, it becomes available so that people can buy it or see it.

example.ex: He is releasing an album of love songs.
example.tran: 他即将推出一张情歌专辑。

value.tran: 发行，推出(唱片、碟片或电影)

value.def: A new release is a new CD, video, or film that has just become available for people to buy or see.

example.ex: Which of the new releases do you think are really good?
example.tran: 在这些新片中你觉得哪些真的不错？

value.tran: 新发行的影片;新片;新碟;发行物

value.def: If a film or video is on release or on general release, it is available for people to see in public cinemas or for people to buy.

example.ex: The video has sold three million copies in its first three weeks on release.
example.tran: 影碟推出的前3周就卖出了300万张。

value.tran: (影片的)上映，公映；（录像带的）发行

trans: (职工)脱产学习，脱产进修制度， 进修休假制度
(有关机构提供给媒体的)新闻稿
监外就业(允许囚犯日间离开监狱外出工作的制度)

partsOfSpeech.dec: lax 松 + ative 有…倾向（性质）的，属于…的 → 让肠胃放松通畅 → 缓泻药
lax 松 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 松弛
leas 松 + e → 把〔房子〕放出去 → 出租
re 重新 + lax 松 → 重新松开 → 放松
re 重新 + lax 松 + ation，relax 的名词 → 休息；娱乐
re 重新 + leas 松 + e → 释放
